docs.lead_paragraph: Bedtime gives us some of our best parenting memories, and some of our worst. There are nights when “The Children’s Hour,” as Longfellow dubbed it, is the sweet, warm essence of all the reasons you had children, but also nights, as Adam Mansbach’s satirical best seller has captured, when you would give anything for them to “Go the ____ to Sleep.”
docs.abstract: Bedtimes defines our pasts and shapes our futures.
docs.snippet: Bedtimes defines our pasts and shapes our futures.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new study of twins released online on Monday marked an important shift in thinking about the causes of autism.

headline.seo: New Autism Study Implicates Environmental Factors
headline.main: New Study Implicates Environmental Factors in Autism
headline.print_headline: Autism Study Finds Link to Environment

docs.snippet: A new study of twins released online on Monday marked an important shift in thinking about the causes of autism.

docs.lead_paragraph: At age 2, children identified as “late talkers” were more likely than other toddlers to have behavioral problems, but there was no difference between the groups at older ages.

headline.seo: No Lasting Problems Seen for Late-Talking Children
headline.main: Patterns: No Lasting Problems Seen for Late Talkers
headline.print_headline: Patterns: No Lasting Problems Seen for Late Talkers

docs.snippet: At age 2, children identified as “late talkers” were more likely than other toddlers to have behavioral problems, but there was no difference between the groups at older ages.

docs.lead_paragraph: In her reply to my column, the author of “Unnatural Selection” also disputes my suggestion that her book’s tone of moral outrage depends on an (implicit) sympathy for aborted female fetuses as well as a concern for the societal impact of sex-selective abortion. “I make very clear in my book that the victim is women,” Hvistendahl writes — “women who in the 1960s and 1970s were used as pawns in a Western drive to reduce birth rates in Asia, women who later aborted female fetuses against the backdrop of patriarchy, and women who, now that they are scarce, find themselves at greater risk of being trafficked, kidnapped, or sold by their parents to men desperate to find wives. Sex-selective abortion is wrong because women should account for half of the human population, and in parts of the world they now account for far less. That alone justifies moral outrage.”

The author of “Unnatural Selection” has kindly written a reply to my column on her book. Not surprisingly, she takes exception to my suggestion that sex-selective abortion poses a problem for pro-choice liberals, arguing that there’s no contradiction at all between supporting abortion rights and trying to restrict/ban abortions based on sex:
docs.abstract: Debating sex selection and abortion with the author of “Unnatural Selection”
docs.snippet: Debating sex selection and abortion with the author of “Unnatural Selection”

docs.lead_paragraph: The state said it issued the license to Planned Parenthood of Kansas and Mid-Missouri after previously denying it under new state regulations that two other clinics are challenging in federal court.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Mets’ relentless offensive run-producing engine stalled out on Thursday in a loss to the Tigers.

headline.print_headline: In Coming Collision, Lots of Momentum: Despite Loss To Verlander, Mets Are Confident For Subway Series

docs.abstract: Detroit Tigers defeat New York Mets, 5-2, as Mets head toward an interleague series against the New York Yankees.
docs.snippet: The Mets’ relentless offensive run-producing engine stalled out on Thursday in a loss to the Tigers.
